Hello mild depression, my old friend. You‚Äôve come to visit me again. I‚Äôve sent my kids unwillingly to their father for two weeks; there‚Äôs a covid outbreak near my mum; I hate xmas but am being guilted to go near that covid outbreak to attend Xmas. What could cause it?

@irisiga @JacquiLambie I am really supportive of PTSD sufferers. Talking to soldiers with PTSD, who have recurring flashbacks- anxiety- fatigue - major depression, I can understand the immense suffering. Psychotropic drugs and CBT can only go so far.

A friend asked how my job search has been going earlier. 

It felt good to be open and honest and talk about my depression.

@TooheyMatthew @CSIsocialimpact Impact on the economy, physical health, mental health, traffic accidents, heart attacks, depression, business losses ‚Äî I could keep going

The Morrison Recession.
The deepest since the Great Depression. More than a million unemployed, more Australians than ever. 160,000 more will lose their jobs between now and the end of the year and Morrison is cutting programs so the recession will be deeper and longer. https://t.co/VjRBWFCmFq
I have anxiety & depression.  These are considered to be symptoms of my MS. I am lucky i was taught to turn up anyway.

@othersideteach Having chronic disease, anxiety & depression,  I've found people don't know what to say - so they don't say anything. They put it off & then feel its too late & are too embarrassed to try
@annabelcrabb @ABCTV Mum's mother and father had a store in the Adelaide Hills. Lost it in the Depression.
@annabelcrabb @ABCTV She would make us all depression food. I had no idea. Mock fish, lamb's fry.
Why @MBA_Aust rejects the attempt by Big Business and Big Unions to embed union power in the worst recession since the Depression #auspol https://t.co/4IvfGvpXRe
@StMaryMacKiller I was solo but diagnosed with a chronic illness, anxiety & depression.  I reskilled for a career change I'd thought about for 20 plus years

And this. 

Looking after everyone in society SAVES money. #compassion #equity #kindness #recession #depression. https://t.co/I8H9dK6xnO
Feeling a little sad & anxious.  Major life change with chronic disease, anxiety & depression but no meds because of testing for a potential tumour is a little rough. #coping

@latingle i appreciated the sensitivity in your report tonight. The economic news is terrifying and triggering. Ive had to take a jnr role and in 3mths I will be paying 2 mortgages on $75k. I hear 'Depression' and then Im numb with fear.

@r_nd_rgh Sometimes but 50 alone again, given up all anti-anxiety, depression meds & off sleep meds while they check an adrenal tumour the idea og being loved, supported & looked after seems more appealing

Or alternatively, you may be experiencing symptoms of depression and anxiety. See your GP for a referral to a psychologist if you feel like this. You can get at least 10 sessions subsided by Medicare. https://t.co/YnIZoiYV8J

I'm sorry I'm over us as people and our small self entitled lives. I am living through a pandemic, not the plague, not a world war- or even a war followed by a pamdemic, followed by a 'great' depression. I'm not at risk of being trafficked so my family can afford to live...
@ZeinaChalich Having the best time I've had as a teacher. Giving up sleep, anti anxiety, depression & pain meds to be checked for an adrenal tumour but mostly holding it all together! üôÑ

@BenSciGuy @Constababble My understanding is they added the orange during the depression and that‚Äôs the cheese the poor got.

@Constababble Nah big difference. I grew up on white american cheese in NJ - land o lakes brand. It was soft, creamy and melted amazingly. It was also salty. Loved it. 

Orange cheese is depression cheese - government coloured it during the depression when they handed it out for free 1/2

Very brave of @TurnbullMalcolm to talk openly about #depression & #mentalhealth. It is heartening that an Australian #PrimeMinister can talk about having to fake everyday life to carry on. Thank you for speaking out.
#abc730 #auspol

@brianweeden @anderscorr @WSJ @realDonaldTrump Hmm not quite as confident about that. I suspect we are in for very dangerous times ahead as our adversaries exploit perceived US vulnerability and windows of opportunity. The Great Depression led to World War. I think major power war is now more likely than less so.

@sallymcmanus You are so right! There needs to be a living wage for everyone with appropriate health care and educational opportunity. This would go a long way to address the pandemic of suicide, anxiety and depression.

@DrSamWillis  @JamesDaybell  The pod on Lonliness: the Plath poem "Tulips" was a real dampener and something I'd avoid like the corona virus. I don't tend towards depression but Wordsworth's Daffs poem was a nice antidote to tulips.
Thanks for the pod, always excellent & cheery

@elwhyte88 @bairdjulia @therealkm2020 It‚Äôs proven that a daily walk in nature reduces stress and depression. A garden can also achieve that (provided you like gardening). @PatsKarvelas Very few people alive now,  remember the Great Depression. I remember my mother‚Äôs description of the desperation and pain. 

This is where we are potentially heading as money stops flowing, mortgage payments not met, loan defaults, unemployment soars, and the economy stagnates.
